medium: Color etching and aquatint with carborandum
creditline: Gift of Herbert Schorr, Graduate School Class of 1963, and Mrs. Schorr
creditlinerepro: © Fundació Antoni Tàpies / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / VEGAP, Madrid / ADAGP, Paris

texts.textentryhtml: A central preoccupation in the work of the Catalan artist Tàpies is the culture and history of his native region of Spain. During the Spanish Civil War, Catalonia was one of the last footholds of resistance to the conservative nationalist party led by the military dictator Francisco Franco. Its residents have fiercely maintained the use of the Catalan language, which was banned by Franco’s government and today is only spoken by a minority within Spain. The resistance and unity of Catalonia is present Empreintes de main; here, the impressions of a row of raised arms attest to the presence of a community of individuals who are joined in action and by the band of oscillating lines across the bottom of the frame.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2003," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 63 (2004): p. 101-141.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2003," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 63 (2004): p. 101-141., p. 115 (illus.)
